meanings.definition: Make a loud noise, as of wind or thunder.
meanings.sent1: The storm outside was whoofing loudly, making me feel scared.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks were whoofing in the sky, lighting up the night.
meanings.sent3: The whoofing wind outside made it hard to hear the movie we were watching.
meanings.sent4: The whoofing sound of the train passing by shook the entire house.
meanings.sent5: The whoofing thunderstorm was so intense, it felt like the sky was angry.

meanings.sent1: The lion let out a whoofing roar that echoed through the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The old car engine was whoofing as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent3: The whoofing sound of the whale underwater was both eerie and beautiful.
meanings.sent4: The whoofing noise of the waterfall could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The whoofing growl of the bear sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: To inhale smoke from a cigarette or pipe and blow it out again.
meanings.sent1: He was whoofing on his pipe, creating a cloud of smoke around him.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy sat on the porch, whoofing on his cigarette as he watched the sunset.
meanings.sent3: She tried whoofing on the hookah for the first time and ended up coughing.
meanings.sent4: The dragon in the movie was whoofing smoke from its nostrils, looking fierce.
meanings.sent5: The old man enjoyed whoofing on his pipe while reminiscing about the past.
